1.name: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
1.description: Exiled into the dangerous forest by her wicked stepmother, a princess is rescued by seven dwarf miners who make her part of their household.

2.name: A Star Is Born
2.description: A young woman comes to Hollywood with dreams of stardom, but achieves them only with the help of an alcoholic leading man whose best days are behind him.

3.name: Lost Horizon
3.description: A plane crash delivers a group of people to the secluded land of Shangri-La - but is it the miraculous utopia it appears to be?

4.name: The Grand Illusion
4.description: During WWI, two French soldiers are captured and imprisoned in a German P.O.W. camp. Several escape attempts follow until they are eventually sent to a seemingly inescapable fortress.

5.name: Nothing Sacred
5.description: An eccentric woman learns she is not dying of radium poisoning as earlier assumed, but when she meets a reporter looking for a story, she feigns sickness again for her own profit.

6.name: The Awful Truth
6.description: Unfounded suspicions lead a married couple to begin divorce proceedings, whereupon they start undermining each other's attempts to find new romance.

7.name: Wells Fargo
7.description: The life and career of a Wells Fargo official frames this fictionalized account of the express company's formation.

8.name: Fire Over England
8.description: Queen Elizabeth is running this show. The men in her court should be thinking about how to add to the glory of the Elizabethan Age and how to foil those pesky Spanish who got far too much ...                See full summary »

9.name: Topper
9.description: A fun-loving couple, finding that they died and are now ghosts, decide to shake up the stuffy lifestyle of a friend of theirs.

10.name: Shall We Dance
10.description: A budding romance between a ballet master and a tap dancer becomes complicated when rumors surface that they're already married.

11.name: Heidi
11.description: A plucky little orphan girl gets dumped abruptly into her gruff, hermit grandfather's care, then later gets retaken and delivered as a companion for an injured girl.

12.name: Way Out West
12.description: Stanley and Ollie are enlisted to deliver the deed to a goldmine in a small village, only for it to be stolen.

13.name: Stage Door
13.description: A chronicle of the ambitions, dreams, and disappointments of aspiring actresses who all live in the same boarding house.

14.name: Dead End
14.description: The lives of a young man and woman, an infamous gangster and a group of street kids converge one day in a volatile New York City slum.

15.name: You Only Live Once
15.description: The public defender's secretary and an ex-convict get married and try to make a life together, but a series of disasters sends their lives spiraling out of control.

16.name: The Good Earth
16.description: Although married Chinese farmers Wang and O-Lan initially experience success, their lives are complicated by declining fortunes and lean times, as well as the arrival of the beautiful young Lotus.

17.name: Captains Courageous
17.description: A spoiled brat who falls overboard from a steamship gets picked up by a fishing boat, where he's made to earn his keep by joining the crew in their work.

18.name: Thoroughbreds Don't Cry
18.description: A cocky young jockey who gets mixed up with some crooked gamblers befriends an English lad with a fast horse and the niece of a woman who runs a boarding house for jockeys.

19.name: Oh, Mr. Porter!
19.description: With the help of a relative, a hopeless railway employee is made stationmaster of Buggleskelly. Determined to make his mark, he devises a number of schemes to put Buggleskelly on the railway map, but instead falls foul of a gang of gun runners.

20.name: The Prisoner of Zenda
20.description: An Englishman on a Ruritarian holiday must impersonate the king when the rightful monarch, a distant cousin, is drugged and kidnapped.

21.name: A Day at the Races
21.description: A veterinarian posing as a doctor and a race-horse owner and his friends struggle to help keep a sanitarium open with the help of a misfit race-horse.

22.name: Parnell
22.description: The life of Irish politician Charles Stewart Parnell, following from 1880 onward his struggle to secure Home Rule, pursued in prison, Parliament, and elsewhere. Emphasis is on the ...                See full summary »

23.name: Young and Innocent
23.description: A man on the run from a murder charge enlists a beautiful stranger who must put herself at risk for his cause.

24.name: The Life of Emile Zola
24.description: The biopic of the famous French muckraking writer and his involvement in fighting the injustice of the Dreyfuss Affair.

25.name: Easy Living
25.description: During the Great Depression, a wealthy banker throws away his wife's expensive fur coat; it lands on the head of a stenographer, leading to everyone assuming she is his mistress and has access to his millions.

26.name: Stella Dallas
26.description: A working-class woman is willing to do whatever it takes to give her daughter a socially promising future.

27.name: Make Way for Tomorrow
27.description: An elderly couple are forced to separate when they lose their house and none of their five children will take both parents in.

28.name: The Hurricane
28.description: A Polynesian sailor -- unjustly imprisoned after defending himself against a colonial bully -- is relentlessly persecuted by his island's martinet French governor.

29.name: That Certain Woman
29.description: Mary Donnell, a young legal secretary with a past, elopes with a client's son, but his father has the marriage annulled without knowing she's pregnant.

30.name: Marked Woman
30.description: A crusading DA persuades a clip joint "party girl" to testify against her mobster boss after her innocent sister is accidentally murdered during one of his unsavory "parties".

31.name: Wee Willie Winkie
31.description: Priscilla Williams, a young girl living with her widowed mother and paternal grandfather at the post he commands in northern India, becomes enamored of military life and embroiled in brewing rebellion against the crown in the early 1900's.

32.name: King Solomon's Mines
32.description: White hunter Allan Quartermain and his enigmatic guide help a young Irish woman locate her missing father in unexplored Darkest Africa.

33.name: Night Must Fall
33.description: When a rich but cantankerous dowager on an isolated estates hires an engaging handyman, her niece/companion becomes suspicious of his motives.

34.name: Hopalong Rides Again
34.description: On a cattle drive Hoppy, camp cook Windy, companion Lucky, and young Artie Peters encounter an eccentric professor. The professor professes to be searching for the evolutionary missing link...                See full summary »

35.name: A Damsel in Distress
35.description: Lady Alyce Marshmorton must marry soon, and the staff of Tottney Castle have laid bets on who she'll choose, with young Albert wagering on "Mr. X". After Alyce goes to London to meet a beau...                See full summary »

36.name: Abus de confiance
36.description: Imposture helps an orphan girl become a lawyer.

37.name: Black Legion
37.description: When a hard-working machinist loses a promotion to a Polish-born worker, he is seduced into joining the secretive Black Legion, which intimidates foreigners through violence.

38.name: Mannequin
38.description: Rags-to-riches Hennessey meets newlyweds Jessie and Eddie from his old neighborhood. Eddie plots to have Jessie divorce him, marry Hennessey, divorce Hennessey, then bring Hennessey's money...                See full summary »

39.name: I, Claudius
39.description: The life and times of the Roman emperor Claudius (10 B.C.-A.D. 54).

40.name: Broadway Melody of 1938
40.description: Steve Raleight wants to produce a show on Broadway. He finds a backer, Herman Whipple and a leading lady, Sally Lee. But Caroline Whipple forces Steve to use a known star, not a newcomer. ...                See full summary »

41.name: Pépé le Moko
41.description: A wanted gangster is both king and prisoner of the Casbah. He is protected from arrest by his friends, but is torn by his desire for freedom outside. A visiting Parisian beauty may just tempt his fate.

42.name: Kid Galahad
42.description: Fight promoter Nick Donati grooms a bellhop as a future champ, but has second thoughts when the 'kid' falls for his sister.

43.name: Saratoga
43.description: After winning a stud farm in lieu of gambling debts, bookie Duke Bradley turns an eye to the daughter of the now deceased gambler and her millionaire fiancée.

44.name: Souls at Sea
44.description: Cooper and Raft save lives during a sea tragedy in this story about slave trade on the high seas in 1842.

45.name: Dark Journey
45.description: During World War I, a German spy and a French spy meet and fall in love.

46.name: History Is Made at Night
46.description: A wealthy divorcée falls for a charming Parisian, but her insanely jealous ex-husband will do anything to get her back.

47.name: Double Wedding
47.description: Two sisters of differing temperaments, the younger's milquetoast fiancé, and a free-spirited artist in an auto trailer are all experiencing romantic complications.

48.name: Bulldog Drummond Escapes
48.description: Captain Drummond becomes a prisoner when he intents to protect a beautiful heiress of an espionage organization.

49.name: The Last Gangster
49.description: A gangster is jailed for ten years after his wife becomes pregnant. He becomes bitter when she divorces him and remarries.

50.name: Sh! The Octopus
50.description: Comedy-mystery finds Detectives Kelly and Dempsey trapped in a deserted lighthouse with a group of strangers who are being terrorized by a killer octopus AND a mysterious crime figure named...                See full summary »
